answers.answer: I might be im doing this all alone ..this should be the happiest time but through this whole pregnacy been so hard I been doin everything on my own
I've been considering the same thing..

I hope somebody is around when my labor starts. But in high risk and calling 911 they would take me to the local hospital. Not a hospital I need to be at. So I will be doing it glad my hospital is only 15-20 min away.

I too may have to do this if my husband and older daughter are not home.I will have to leave my 3 year old with my 73 year old MIL and take myself to hospital & wait for someone to meet me there.I too am nervous about this scenario.
Same here hope im not left alone like always..:(

My mom did it she even took a shower did her hair and make up...and put on heels + washes clothes....her water broke and everything her contractions were so close together I didnt even no how she pull it off

I may do it as well.. my father in law is a lovely person but a terrible driver lol and he may be the only driver around if my water breaks in the middle of the week since my mom doesnt drive and my hubbu will be at work...

I've had preeclampsia problems and drove myself to the hospital twice already to be monitored. Each time the doctor has sent me to the hospital my husband has been out of town working. So when the time comes ill probably be driving myself as well!
I drove myself with my first and was just fine.  Although luckily I won't have to this time around.
My last one was 10 years ago.. My water broke, I put a towel on the driver's seat, put my youngest son in his car seat and drove 45 minutes to the hospital. My mom met me there:)

If you call 911 you can request which hospital. I had an ambulance called after i was in a car accident and they took me to a hospital that was 45 min away because I told them that's where I want to go, even though there were 3 other hospitals less than 15 min away
I live just outside the city so things like car accidents will to a better trauma hospital. But pregnancy go to local hospital.
I was in no trauma though it was a fender bender and actually I turned down going To a level 1 trauma center to go to a community hospital
I hope I won't have to drive myself but the due date is in Nov when my older kids are in school so it may come down to that depending on how it goes.

question: DURING ACTIVE LABOR... How many of you moms recommend this...and have done this...?¿¡!
title: DROVE YOURSELF TO HOSPITAL?¿¡!
